name: Doll, Joe Cobb from Our Gang, ca. 1927
description: Doll based on the character Joe Cobb as he appears in the Our Gang short film series. The 11.75" doll is dressed in a knit sweater and cap with a white and gray diamond pattern, and corduroy pants. The doll has composition hands and head, with hand painted features, while the limbs and torso are tinplate armature with some padding. The doll is fitted with a wind-up mechanism that is activated by a crank in its back.
creator: Hal Roach Studios (Licensor) Sayco Doll Corporation (Manufacturer)
historic_note: Because this figure is not with its original packaging, it is difficult to determine exactly when it was produced and released to the public. The character Joe Cobb was one of the first members of the Our Gang kids, starring in the series between the years of 1923 and 1929. However, the other dolls which were released alongside the Joe Cobb doll by the Sayco Doll Corporation (Farina and Jean Darling) were based on characters whose collective roles only overlapped during the years 1927-1929. Therefore, it is most likely that this series of dolls was produced sometime between 1927 and 1929.
credit: Gift of Gary and Dana Stein
